revised_title: Anatomy and Physiology of Doris: A Comprehensive Study
tldr: This paper presents a detailed study of the anatomy and physiology of the Doris species, a type of Nudibranchiate Mollusca. The authors describe the digestive, reproductive, circulatory, respiratory, and nervous systems, as well as the sensory organs of these creatures. They also discuss the triple circulation system in Mollusca and the existence of a true sympathetic or organic nervous system in Doris.
